Heya,
> This is a bug I just noticed from the previous converter.  Apparantly,
> the converter re-aligned teleporters in one of my scenarios [Weakest
> Link], by changing values out.  Was that problem ever fixed?  When I
> last saved the file, I had all of my teleporters in a specific
> alignment, and that's how I noticed the change?

The only changes I made in the update were dealing with how the code looks
and tidyness in output - nothing at all with the actual conversion
process...

In theory the converter is supposed to leave the objects in the same order
when converting - nothing with sorting has yet been done (busy with uni
assignments).
This means that if you convert the file to text, then back without changing
it, you should get the original file (with the exception of 'garbage
characters' in arrrays).  If the converter is changing values or positions
of objects it's not supposed to be doing that - and that is definitely a bug
:)

Could you describe the problem in a little more detail?  For instance if you
convert back and forth without changing the files does it still muck up the
alignment, and by alignment what do you mean - the order of teleportation,
what it links to, etc.
If I can work out what to look for I'll be able to find the problem :)

Cya,
Deathifier
